lines.content: Grizzly is a simple Task management chatbot that helps you keep track of **todos, events, and deadlines**
It also supports saving of Tasks, so that you don't lose track of your saved items when restarting the chatbot.
Deadlines are Tasks that have to be completed before a specified Date/Time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list
Todos are Tasks that do not have a specific Date/Time for completion.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Events are Tasks that have a specified Date/Time of happening.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list
Tasks can be marked/unmarked with an 'X' to denote completion.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Tasks can be deleted from Grizzly as easily as they are added.
I've deleted this item from the list:
Here are the tasks in your list:
Tasks added to Grizzly so far can be viewed using the **print** or **list** command.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Search for a Task that has been added to Grizzly using the **find** command to search keywords.
Here are the matching tasks in your list
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Grizzly is a simple Task management chatbot that helps you keep track of **todos, events, and deadlines**
It also supports saving of Tasks, so that you don't lose track of your saved items when restarting the chatbot.

* A task with a due date (rendered as "(by: <date>)").
* Immutable aside from the inherited {@code isMarked} flag.
* @param data   short description of the task; non-null
* @param date   due date string to display (no parsing enforced here); non-null
public Deadline(String data, String date, boolean marked) {
* A task that occurs at a specified time (rendered as "(from: <date>)").
* Immutable aside from the inherited {@code isMarked} flag.
* @param data   short description of the event; non-null
* @param date   time/date string to display (no parsing enforced here); non-null
public Event(String data, String date, boolean marked) {
* Entry point of the Grizzly chatbot application.

*

The {@code main} method initializes the application, loads any previously
* saved tasks, prints a greeting, and then enters a read–evaluate–print loop
* (REPL). Each line of user input is parsed into a command word, and dispatched to
* the corresponding handler in {@link TaskList}, {@link Storage}, or {@link Ui}.

*
  • unmark <index> — mark a task as not completed

*
  • find <keyword> — search for tasks containing a keyword

*
  • print — print raw contents of the text file

*

All commands read from {@code System.in} and print results to {@code System.out}.
* Utility for parsing raw user input into commands and arguments,
* and for constructing {@link Task} objects from argument tokens.
* Splits input into at most two parts: command word and remainder.

* Base type for all task variants (e.g., {@link ToDo}, {@link Deadline}, {@link Event}).
* A task has a textual description and a completion flag ({@code isMarked}).
* Subclasses customize the printed "type" tag, the toString() method, and other variables.
* Description of the task as shown to the user.
* Whether the task is completed (true) or not (false).
* Constructs a task with the given description, that is initially unmarked.
* Zero-arg constructor for frameworks/tests; leaves fields at defaults.
* @param marked {@code true} to mark completed; {@code false} to unmark
/// Return the type of the Task
* Manages the in-memory list of {@link Task} objects and provides
* operations to mutate and query them (add, delete, mark, find).

*

This class is integrated with {@link Storage} to keep the file synchronized.
